algorithm_technique: Breadth-First Search (BFS) to explore reachable indices
problem_summary_simple: Find if any index with value 0 can be reached from a starting index by jumping forward or backward.
problem_summary_technical: BFS on an implicit graph where nodes are array indices and edges are possible jumps, using a set for visited nodes.
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as a graph traversal where indices are nodes and jumps are edges.
BFS is suitable for finding if a target state (index with value 0) is reachable.
A 'visited' set is crucial to prevent infinite loops in case of cycles.
